title: Sayrix
author: Sayrix
created_time: August 18, 2023, 02:16:34 PMLast edit: April 28, 2024, 07:08:17 PM by Sayrix
content: Hi, I'm a developer and I made a 100% automatic Escrow Discord bot for the moment it only supports Litecoin, Dogecoin and Bitcoin but if the bot makes some success I'll add support for other cryptocurrencies.Here is the Discord server: https://autoplus.ggI don't have many customers and I suppose that's logical, nobody trusts something that comes out of nowhere and I'm aware of that that's why the bot only has 0. 05% fee, it's to allow people to test the bot with small sums so they can see how it works and I hope as time goes by people will use the bot for their trades where they wouldn't like to be ripped off, my goal is not for people to use the bot with large sums but simply to allow anyone to avoid being ripped off, especially people who don't have a lot of money.If you have any suggestions please say it to me here or on Discord!And btw, i'm new on Bitcoin Talk

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: Sayrix on August 18, 2023, 02:16:34 PMHi, I'm a developer and I made a 100% automatic Escrow Discord bot for the moment it only supports Litecoin, Dogecoin and Bitcoin but if the bot makes some success I'll add support for other cryptocurrencies.Here is the Discord server: https://discord.gg/middlebotI don't have many customers and I suppose that's logical, nobody trusts something that comes out of nowhere and I'm aware of that that's why the bot only has 0. 05% fee, it's to allow people to test the bot with small sums so they can see how it works and I hope as time goes by people will use the bot for their trades where they wouldn't like to be ripped off, my goal is not for people to use the bot with large sums but simply to allow anyone to avoid being ripped off, especially people who don't have a lot of money.If you have any suggestions please say it to me here or on Discord!And btw, i'm new on Bitcoin TalkI don't think that anyone would be agree to use such type of bots that are controlled by someone whom they don't really know personally. Although, I must say that you have tried your best to create that bot and added support for Bitcoin and some other alternative coins, but I'm still sure that no body is going to trust a bot from someone they don't really know.Even if you make the bot fee-less I still doubt that anyone would ever use such bot due to trust issues. On this forum there are many reputed members who work as escrow for transactions and people would also prefer those reputed members instead of trusting a bot that came from nowhere, and they aren't even sure that who's the creator behind the bot.If you really want to promote your bot on this forum then you must have to built up trust first which isn't as easy as it sounds like. You may also try to offer this bot to some reputed escrow providers of the forum and if they agree to buy this bot from you then that would be a really good thing for you. Otherwise, I don't think that such bot would ever get any users from this forum due to trust issues.

comments.author: Sayrix
comments.body: Hey! 8 months later, the project has changed and grown and I'm extremely proud of it, The project is now called AutoPlus, supports Litecoin, Dogecoin, USDT SOL and Solana. Over $23k has been handled by the bot with over 230 unique users and over 450 trades completed and our biggest deal was a deal of 1500$. Discord doesn't really like this kind of business (especially the type of trades carried out using the bot), which is why the server was banned yesterday. Before the ban we had managed to reach 1500 members on Discord. And now, after the ban, we're already down to almost 100 members. To prevent people from falling for imposters, we've set up a site with the invitation link to the current server: https://autoplus.gg

comments.author: Sayrix
comments.body: Hey! Here's a follow-up after now almost 1 year since I made this post here. Since my last follow-up 4 months ago, our server hasn't been re-banned and we've now held over $50k in volume, so that's nearly doubled in 2x less time! There have been a total of 926 completed transactions. Since then, I've added the Ethereum blockchain with the ETH, USDT ERC-20 and USDC ERC-20 coins, I've also added USDC SOL and removed Dogecoin due to its low number of uses but I'm thinking of adding it again when I think it'll be worth it. These stats aren't huge, I suppose there are middleman holding more than $50k every day, but it shows that people are starting to embrace the project and that there is growth. I'm still hopeful and I don't intend to stop here.For people who said "how can we make sure that it's real", as i said before, all our transactions with their transaction id are public in the Discord server, but i forgot to mention that all transactions are paying the fee address and that so, by checking all utxo of the address you can check everytime the bot has sent money since there are a OP_RETURN including the website url. Here is the fee address on the Litecoin network: ltc1qes0du76fxgfpk59yls4gajrwffa8j3z3kpfees and Solana Network: FeesjkgM85w3z32hhFqGCAQDxNuL1uUEZHgFnNEEmBXh
